pull_requests.title: Fix carriage return in `.gitignore` on Windows
pull_requests.body:
## Description

Turns out that we shouldn't use `os.linesep` when writing to a file in text mode. From [the docs](https://docs.python.org/3/library/os.html#os.linesep):

> Do not use os.linesep as a line terminator when writing files opened in text mode (the default); use a single '\n' instead, on all platforms.

It can be a bit difficult to test platform specific bugs on post-generation hooks so I decided to start writing one.

Checklist:

- [ ] I've made sure that `tests/test_cookiecutter_generation.py` is updated accordingly (especially if adding or updating a template option)
- [ ] I've updated the documentation or confirm that my change doesn't require any updates

## Rationale

Fix #3292

pull_requests.title: Fix BrowserSync config on non-Docker setup
pull_requests.body:
## Description

The curent BrowserSync setup works with Docker, but not without. The localhost URL at port `3000` doesn't load, the page keeps loading forever. It seems to be an issue with the BrowserSync package, there are a few issues that seem related:

- https://github.com/BrowserSync/browser-sync/issues/1163
- https://github.com/BrowserSync/browser-sync/issues/936
- https://github.com/BrowserSync/browser-sync/issues/1667

The only difference I could find between the 2 setup was that Docker had a different hostname. I tried to proxy to a different hostname resolving to localhost and it fixed it.

Checklist:

- [ ] I've made sure that tests are updated accordingly: n/a
- [ ] I've updated the documentation or confirm that my change doesn't require any updates

pull_requests.title: Fix dockertests on branches containing slashes
pull_requests.body:
#### Describe the changes
I noticed that the dockertests [were failing](https://github.com/browniebroke/pyfakefs/actions/runs/3766893340/jobs/6403878811#step:3:977) on my branches. 

I thought it was because they are on a fork, but it's actually because my branches contained slashes `/` which means the [`$(basename $GITHUB_REF)`](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pyfakefs/blob/c617fceb91bf5e4331752fcabb9c1620859b3222/.github/workflows/dockertests.yml#L17) didn't resolve correctly to the branch name. GitHub provides another env variable `GITHUB_REF_NAME` which contains the correct value, so we can just use that instead. 

Fixing this [broke the `unzip` commands](https://github.com/browniebroke/pyfakefs/actions/runs/3766946009/jobs/6403987731#step:3:989) in the Dockerfiles, which we can avoid by setting the filename with `-O` when downloading with `wget`.

#### Tasks
- [ ] Unit tests added that reproduce the issue or prove feature is working
- [ ] Fix or feature added
- [ ] Entry to release notes added
- [ ] Pre-commit CI shows no errors
- [ ] Unit tests passing
- [ ] For documentation changes: The Read the Docs preview builds and looks as expected

pull_requests.title: Fail the build if check raises a warning
pull_requests.body:
## Description

- Update test script to fail if the `check` command flags any warnings
- Simplify the `TEMPLATES` settings as explained [here](https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/issues/3475#issuecomment-996186254) 

Checklist:

- [x] I've made sure that tests are updated accordingly (especially if adding or updating a template option)
- [x] I've updated the documentation or confirm that my change doesn't require any updates

## Rationale

Our template settings are configuring the `loaders` option explicitely, and this option is optimised in the production/test setttings to wrap the `cached.Loader`, which duplciates this list of loaders in 3 places.

However, it seems that our config can be replicated by setting `APP_DIRS=True`:

- It has the same list of loaders when `DEBUG=True`
- When `DEBUG=False`, the list is wrapped with `cached.Loader`

Fixes #3475

- [ ] I've made sure that tests are updated accordingly (especially if adding or updating a template option)
- [ ] I've updated the documentation or confirm that my change doesn't require any updates

## Rationale

Docker is emitting a warning: 
```
mount of type `volume` should not define `bind` option
```

Fix #3685

pull_requests.title: KARAF-4897 - Add an option to simplify bundle dependencies
pull_requests.body:
This adds a simplifyBundleDependencies option to
GenerateDescriptorMojo, disabled by default, which drops bundle
dependencies from features if the bundles are included in "parent"
features. I.e. if feature A depends on bundle B and feature C, and
feature C also includes bundle B, then feature A will be reduced to
only depend on feature C, relying on the latter to supply bundle B.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

Process movies in the same way as other resources.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <steve@sk2.org>

This isn't used, and the hard-coded nettest image isn't always appropriate. Lighthouse has its own version of this which handled varying images appropriately.

pull_requests.title: Drop the version tag from the Submariner CR
pull_requests.body:
The bundle used for Submariner contains the relevant image hashes, so we shouldn't need to override the version with a tag any more. Specifying the tag means that OpenShift's disconnected setup features can't be used; removing the tag should enable them.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Drop obsolete client-go auth plugins
pull_requests.body:
The OpenStack plugin is no longer available, even in version 0.24.4 of client-go; see
https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/blob/v0.24.4/plugin/pkg/client/auth/openstack/openstack_stub.go It is replaced by the client-keystone-auth credential plugin. The plugin has been entirely removed in client-go 0.26.0, which breaks the build when any other dependency pulls in client-go 0.26.0 or later.

The GCP plugin is deprecated in K8s 1.22+ and unavailable in 1.26+ (although it is still stubbed in client-go 0.26.0). Is it replaced by the gke-gcloud-auth-plugin credential plugin.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Merge the api module back into the main module
pull_requests.body:
Go dependencies are handled by package, not by module, and per-package
splits are handled correctly. Having a separate package makes it
easier to track dependencies, but it can cause friction when handling
sub-module updates, and it leads to difficulties with go install (see
<https://github.com/golang/go/issues/44840>).

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Use k8s utils pointer instead of Azure autorest/to
pull_requests.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/first-contribution.md#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-testing/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

#### What type of PR is this?

/kind cleanup

<!--
Add one of the following kinds:
/kind bug
/kind cleanup
/kind documentation
/kind feature

Optionally add one or more of the following kinds if applicable:
/kind api-change
/kind deprecation
/kind failing-test
/kind flake
/kind regression
-->

#### What this PR does / why we need it:

Since k/u includes pointer functions which are equivalent to the autorest/to pointer functions, and the latter are deprecated, it seems useful to switch to the former:
* to.FooPtr becomes pointer.Foo
* to.Foo becomes pointer.FooDeref with an appropriate default
* to.StringSlicePtr becomes &

This doesn't remove anything from vendor, but it does turn the dependency into an indirect one, ready to be removed when the rest of the Azure migration happens.

#### Which issue(s) this PR fixes:
<!--
*Automatically closes linked issue when PR is merged.
Usage: `Fixes #<issue number>`, or `Fixes (paste link of issue)`.
_If PR is about `failing-tests or flakes`, please post the related issues/tests in a comment and do not use `Fixes`_*
-->

This is related to #112431 (but doesn‚Äôt fix it).

#### Special notes for your reviewer:

#### Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".

For more information on release notes see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->
```release-note
NONE
```

#### Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.:

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

When adding links which point to resources within git repositories, like
KEPs or supporting documentation, please reference a specific commit and avoid
linking directly to the master branch. This ensures that links reference a
specific point in time, rather than a document that may change over time.

See here for guidance on getting permanent links to files: https://help.github.com/en/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files

Please use the following format for linking documentation:
- [KEP]: <link>
- [Usage]: <link>
- [Other doc]: <link>
-->

```

pull_requests.title: Run the upgrade job only on devel
pull_requests.body:
This job doesn't work on any branch other than devel: it always downloads the latest release, and tries to "upgrade" from there, whereas on non-devel branches it would have to download the last release from the branch preceding the target branch (e.g. the last 0.13.x on the release-0.14 branch).

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Avoid redacting with the empty string
pull_requests.body:
As our token and PSK handling evolves, stored values can end up being
empty; attempting to redact logs when a value to be redacted is empty
replaces between every UTF-8 sequence (see
<https://pkg.go.dev/strings#ReplaceAll>). To avoid this, refrain from
redacting if the relevant value is empty.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Use order-only prerequisites for tools
pull_requests.body:
Currently, the tools used during the build (e.g. controller-gen) are
rebuilt if their dependencies change, and then the files generated by
the tools are rebuilt because the tool was rebuilt. This isn't
desirable in day-to-day use; to avoid having tool rebuilds cause
regeneration of all the files and thus recompilation of everything in
most cases, this patch changes concrete targets to specify the
required tools using order-only prerequisites.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Expose the "insecure broker connections" setting
pull_requests.body:
It can be useful to disable certificate validation when connecting to the broker; Submariner allows this but the corresponding setting isn't exposed in SubmarinerConfig, and thus can't be set (since the settings in SubmarinerConfig overwrite any different settings in the corresponding Submariner CR).

This adds an "InsecureBrokerConnection" flag in SubmarinerConfig.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

pull_requests.title: Use k8s.io/utils/pointer instead of go-autorest/to
pull_requests.body:
https://github.com/Azure/go-autorest is deprecated and will no longer be supported after March 31, 2023; see
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/updates/support-for-azure-sdk-libraries-that-do-not-conform-to-our-current-azure-sdk-guidelines-will-be-retired-as-of-31-march-2023/

We only use go-autorest to create pointers; this replaces such calls with calls to equivalent k8s.io/utils functions.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Kitt <skitt@redhat.com>

Now circular reference issue is resolved in TOT, this changes will allow import Observable only makes to work with `of` and `from`.

relates to #878 

Continue to effort remove `thisArg`.

pull_requests.title: refactor(Observable): remove exhaust from core rx
pull_requests.body:
Relates to PR https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJS/pull/1002,

found out reading https://github.com/justinwoo/RxJS/commit/767b1f54e2d73551f3f1c156f6e1714502cd79e4#commitcomment-14966118, `exhaust` and `exhausemap` lives on Observable core and KitchenSink both. Removed from `Observable` to match with original PR intended as 'removes both operators from Rx core output'.

pull_requests.title: refactor(distinctUntilKeyChanged): remote thisArg
pull_requests.body: PR https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJS/pull/993 updates interface of `distinctUntilKeyChanged`, this PR removes thisArg from implementation.

pull_requests.body:

to be undefined. This change updates behavior to align behavior
as same as RxJS4 does.

closes #1081

I'll leave this PR around day and close it without merging in this weekend.

pull_requests.title: Proposal : remove circular reference using ambient merge
pull_requests.body:
### Proposal : not to be merged yet

This PR is proposal to resolve https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJS/issues/899, via ambient declaration merging introduced in typescript (https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/3332).

for any parents requires to have declaration of inherited childs, it imports ambient declarations instead of actual implementation of child to remove circular dependencies. Since reference to child from parents is mostly for type declaration only, this doesn't affect actual functionality in general.

Still for some cases functionality's breaking, such as this PR regresses https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJS/pull/863 due to failed to check type of `Subject` since ambient declaration doesn't allow type checking. Yet this is proposal, PR does not include those refactoring but only include necessary changes.

pull_requests.title: refactor(Symbol): introduce unified Symbol module
pull_requests.body:
closes #844 

This PR creates single module for symbols, integrates separated `symbol_xxx` modules. As mentioned in https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJS/issues/844 typescript supports es6 global symbol which causes name collision, picked `SymbolShim` as initial name. Might be better name for module, creating PR to get some suggestions.

and update import references accordingly.

pull_requests.title: Patch custom Error object to inherit base Error
pull_requests.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for your pull request!

If your PR is the addition of a new operator, please make sure all these boxes are ticked with an x:

- [ ] Add the operator to Rx
- [ ] It must have a `-spec.ts` tests file covering the canonical corner cases, with marble diagram tests
- [ ] If possible, write a `asDiagram` test case too, for PNG diagram generation purposes
- [ ] The spec file should have a type definition test at the end of the spec to verify type definition for various use cases
- [ ] The operator must be documented in JSDoc style in the implementation file, including also the PNG marble diagram image
- [ ] The operator should be listed in `doc/operators.md` in a category of operators
- [ ] It should also be inserted in the operator decision tree file `doc/decision-tree-widget/tree.yml`
- [ ] You may need to update `MIGRATION.md` if the operator differs from the corresponding one in RxJS v4
-->

**Description:**
Per breaking changes of TS 2.1 (https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-wiki/blob/master/Breaking-Changes.md#extending-built-ins-like-error-array-and-map-may-no-longer-work) Inheriting built in object no longer gives prototype chain. This PR updates each custom error object to have prototype of Error.

**Related issue (if exists):**
#2178 

*BREAKING CHANGE*: This change drops support of IE 10 and prior

pull_requests.title: test(filter): enable type inference to marble diagram
pull_requests.body:
‚ö†Ô∏è Targeting master ‚ö†Ô∏è

- [x] Non-breaking change

**Description:**

This PR resolves long-pending issue #1633, provides type inference to marble-diagram based test cases while does not hurt documentation for specs. It is using TypeScript compiler's feature to import type signature without real module import and assign it to existing ambient declaration - ambient declaration will provide same type inference to exported modules.

**Why Targeting master?**
Originally test case were designed to be used as validating type definition as well for most common usage cases to prevent issue like https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs/issues/2163 . Due to current setup ergonomics, all of tests are running without any compiler validation so there wasn't any regression testing for type definitions, which should be considered as breaking change if occurs. 

This PR will enable all test cases to have correct compiler type inference, allows all test cases become first-guard to type definition validation. Once this PR is accepted, I'll work on other test cases to have same changes.

**Related issue (if exists):**
#1633

pull_requests.title: feat(tab): enable cycle tab selection
pull_requests.body:
- closes #258 

I took a stab myself for this feature, while I also have relatively high confidence PR is not feasible to be accepted. 

This PR exposes one more settings values to allow `cycle` tab selection, either next / previous tab hotkey will select to last / first tab if user specifies to.

point of consideration
1. may possible to control this behavior via plugin instead of core?
: I couldn't find relative interface support, but maybe I am lack of knowledge simply.

2. Is it feasible to expose under application settings, under `appearance`? 
: It isn't actually appearance but more about behavior, while current settings doesn't have specific category. Hotkey provider is managing assigned key combination, so picked current one instead.

3. Would it be better to have checkbox instead of radio?
: this may not be big deal (and could reuse all styles), but still this could be checkbox for boolean flag.

pull_requests.title: ci(actions): setup yarn cache
pull_requests.body:
### Description

context: https://discord.com/channels/889779439272075314/889780890098610176/919288953490780181

To workaround the recent CI flaky failure caused by npm pkg installation, I tried pnp. It was mostly working, but some of bundler-related tests expected physical layout of node_modules to resolve its deps.

This PR instead took easy win by setting up dep cache supported by gh actions by default: https://github.com/actions/setup-node/blob/main/docs/advanced-usage.md#caching-packages-dependencies

If we're lucky global cache may reduce network related failures.

pull_requests.title: build(package): update changelog, pr template
pull_requests.body:
From core team discussion:

This PR adds two things in the repo:

- PR template: to fill in brief description / issue links
- `npm run changelog`: generate changelog from conventional commits for new version.

`npm run changelog` script depends on pkg manifest version, so it needs to be generated after bump up `@swc/core` version in package.json. Unfortunately it doesn't account individual cargo version update yet. Not sure if it's possible even.

To fully benefit changelog generate commit needs to include breaking changes as well. This is an example commit https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs/pull/6295/commits/61fd4aacc6e30f1de494336a06b95c72f6b79ee8

if commit body contains `BREAKING CHANGES: ${description}` changelog script will parse it.

pull_requests.title: build(next/core): allow to specify tls backend for reqwest
pull_requests.body:
Implement / fixes WEB-306.

We can't rely on default tls backend for reqwest and hope to work with every target platform we support, due to several constraints. Some target cannot use -sys (openssl-sys), and some can't build rustls due to trasnsitive dep support issue.

PR creates explicit opt-in features for those and let upstream application can specify what they need. `next-dev` currently sets `native-tls` as default for the general dev workflow conveniences, but that doesn't mean we promote it as default feature set - next-swc, or other like standalone turbopack will configure features by themselves when build binaries for their own.

pull_requests.title: feat(mdx): initial turbopack-mdx asset
pull_requests.body:
Implements / fix WEB-86. This PR is an initial attempt to support mdx natively inside of turbopack. 

It uses mdxrs (https://github.com/wooorm/mdxjs-rs) internally to interop - compile - mdx inputs into renderable ecma outputs. PR creates a new type of asset `MDXAsset`, and then let its extension (`.mdx`) can be consumed by turbopack. 

Since mdx is a variant of ecma asset to be rendered, it requires to perform all of the ecma transforms in the current running turbopack session. But since its AST is not compatible to plain swc (or ecma), it also cannot be passed into existing ecmaassets. MDXAsset does interop for those, by creating a virtualasset for the ecma once mdx is compiled into plain ecma. This might not be feasible appoarch and requires different way to chain asset types, something I'd like to address in this PR. I guess this will be needed for other types of assets in a long run - where input is not an ecma but requires ecma transforms (i.e vue, ng templates).

pull_requests.title: build(cargo): allow to control reqwest tls backend
pull_requests.body:
This PR allows to control TLS backend for the dependency `reqwest`, while makes default (native-tls) as-is. Only if someone need to explicitly control they can disable default, then opt into specific.

`reqwest` is build-dependencies, so may seems it doesn't cause any problem: however, due to cargo creates lockfile & compiles it can actually brings some interesting challenges. 

```
// Cargo.toml: Application

[dependencies]
LibA = *

// Cargo.toml: LibA
[dependencies]
reqwest = {.., features = ["rustls-tls"]}
markdown = *

// Cargo.toml: markdown

[build-dependencies]
reqwest = * // default, native-tls is enabled
```

Now building `Application` generates a lockfile for it, and cargo _merges_ every feature for the dependencies into single like 

```
reqwest = {
...
features = ["rustls-tls", "native-tls"]
}
```

regardless of type of dependencies. There are target platforms require specific TLS backend only, now building `Application` fails on those platform.

I tried to make this change non-invasive as much. Default works exactly same as current, and only explicit opt-in would change its behavior. Also added cases for 1. for disabling tls entirely, attempt to use `http` with warning 2. specifying both tls fails build.

pull_requests.title: ci(action): auto update PR for swc_*
pull_requests.body:
This PR is an experiment I'd like to try for WEB-254. In short, it'll try to create consolidated PR for swc_* bump (currently swc_core + plugins, except mdx) when there's a new version published.

The logic is fairly starightforward - it checks `cargo upgrade` periodically then create PR if there are updates. 

I am aware we have renovatebot setup in this repo - eventually using it may better. Currently, there are few custom tailor I wanted to have (having all swc_* changes in a single PR, no `update` but `upgrade`) that was easier to try out with this action.

SWC plugin hoping to have auto merge + publish with this (https://github.com/swc-project/plugins/issues/120), which will potentially allow a chained automatic processes across repos. mdx is an exception, but something we can consider later.

build(cargo): use mocha for exec_ test in cargo
pull_requests.body:
## Description

This PR replaces test runner from `jest` to `mocha` for the tests executed via rust test cases, notably using `exec_with_jest`.

### Motivation

jest is great test framework but it is quite heavyweight. It have several stages of test environment setup for its features like test isolation in vm, transpilation support etcs. In result, each bootstrap to jest takes amount of time always. In case of cargo test per each test cases generated as temporary js test suite we spin up new node.js processes with jest per each file. This effectively makes jest's test isolation not required but still have to spend process warmup time per each file. 

Mocha in opposite it is lightweight test runner does not provide those functionaility, instead performs quite faster when it comes to bootstrap. Since Mocha doesn't provide any assertions by default we can use jest's assertion library without replacing lot of test cases. (Actually one 1 test case accessing global jest. need to be updated).

Here's brief execution time comparision between 2 when running `swc_ecma_transforms_compat`. It's from local machine and I think number may vary on CI but also shows obvious gain.

(`hyperfine -w 3 "cargo test --package swc_ecma_transforms_compat"`)
```
//mocha

Benchmark 1: cargo test --package swc_ecma_transforms_compat
  Time (mean ¬± œÉ):     17.259 s ¬±  1.893 s    [User: 129.996 s, System: 17.067 s]
  Range (min ‚Ä¶ max):   14.240 s ‚Ä¶ 19.987 s    10 runs
```

```
//jest

Benchmark 1: cargo test --package swc_ecma_transforms_compat
  Time (mean ¬± œÉ):     116.293 s ¬±  2.252 s    [User: 846.903 s, System: 281.885 s]
  Range (min ‚Ä¶ max):   114.217 s ‚Ä¶ 121.382 s    10 runs
```

**PR doesn't replace jest for node-swc tests**: I cannot 100% sure if there's specific reason to use jest for those legit node.js side test cases. For now PR doesn't touch it, depends on usecases we _may_ replace it. But having dedicated test runners for each different purpose won't harm in my opinion.

pull_requests.title: ci(actions): trying to create auto upgrade PR for swc_*
pull_requests.body:
This PR trying to experiment automated action to create a PR to upgrade swc_* when a new version is released. `swc_core` is changing rapidly, and there are several pieces we need to align when we want to upgrade dependencies altogether so I hope this could reduce some of manual steps.


It is an action runs periodically (2 times a daily) which runs `cargo upgrade`, then create a PR if there's an update to be applied. If there is an open PR with a specific branch name, it won't create new but trying to update PR with new commit when there's an update.

To create fully working pull request, action requires personal access token unfortunately. I choose name `GHA_UPGRADE_TOKEN` for those, having one under repository secrets will enable action to perform: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1210596/205413551-2f078a75-64c6-414a-8f42-6b33aa1c08ad.png)

We can use default `GITHUB_TOKEN` still, but it'll create PR with limited acesss with github-actions bot will not trigger any action to verify build is passing or not. (ref: https://github.com/peter-evans/create-pull-request/issues/48)

pull_requests.title: ci(actions): trying to auto upgrade swc_*
pull_requests.body:
This PR trying to experiment automated action to create a PR to upgrade swc_* when new version is released. It is an action runs periodically (2 times a daily) which runs `cargo upgrade`, then create a PR if there's an update to be applied. If there is an open PR with specific branch name, it won't create new but trying to update PR with new commit when there's an update.

To create fully working pull request, action requires personal access token unfortunately. I choose name `GHA_UPGRADE_TOKEN` for those, having one under repository secrets will enable action to perform: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1210596/205413551-2f078a75-64c6-414a-8f42-6b33aa1c08ad.png)

We can use default `GITHUB_TOKEN` still, but it'll create PR with limited acesss with github-actions bot will not trigger any action to verify build is passing or not. (ref: https://github.com/peter-evans/create-pull-request/issues/48)

My goal is let these actions run across transitive deps we own, so most of upgrade process is simple enough to click merge btn unless there are breaking changes.

pull_requests.title: ci(actions): pin prod-test action image
pull_requests.body:
<!--
Thanks for opening a PR! Your contribution is much appreciated.
To make sure your PR is handled as smoothly as possible we request that you follow the checklist sections below.
Choose the right checklist for the change that you're making:
-->

## Bug

Test(Production) CI fails with error

```
Package libicu66 is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source

E: Package 'ttf-unifont' has no installation candidate
E: Package 'ttf-ubuntu-font-family' has no installation candidate
E: Unable to locate package libenchant1c2a
E: Package 'libicu66' has no installation candidate
E: Unable to locate package libvpx6
E: Unable to locate package libwebp6
Failed to install browser dependencies
```

This is due to new release for the runner image (https://github.com/actions/runner-images/issues/6399) now sets ubuntu 22.04 as latest, but playwright have release to support it (https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/13738) but @replayio/playwright seems not picked it up yet (https://github.com/replayio/replay-cli/blob/main/packages/playwright/package.json#L23) 

PR tries to pin to known working image (20.04) until dependencies can support new image gracefully.

pull_requests.title: feat: drop Node 10 support
pull_requests.body:
- If we want to update our `eslint-plugin-eslint-plugin` dependency to v4, we also need `Node@^12.22.0 || ^14.17.0 || >=16.0.0`
  https://github.com/not-an-aardvark/eslint-plugin-eslint-plugin/blob/6c58c91cefffd5433a01d90f802e9152cdebbcdd/package.json#L70-L72

- Node 10 is EOL, so it's a good practice to not support it anymore.

- ESLint 8.x requires `Node@^12.22.0 || ^14.17.0 || >=16.0.0` and imo it's a good practice to keep the Node version equal to that of the latest supported ESLint version
  https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/fa4d4830a0e77f92154079ada17ffb893ce64232/package.json#L146-L148

---

BREAKING CHANGE: Requires Node@^12.22.0 || ^14.17.0 || >=16.0.0

pull_requests.title: [eslint-config-universe] bump dependencies to support TS 4.9
pull_requests.body:
# Why

Let's get rid of the unsupported TS version warning when using universe config in project with latest TypeScript:
* https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/releases/tag/v5.45.0

# How

Bump `typescript-eslint` dependencies to versions which includes TS 4.9 support. 

As in latest version, I have also bumped other outdated dependencies which are a part of the package.

# Test Plan

After bumping TS in detached docs and linking the local config package with the updated dependencies the TS version warning do not appear anymore.

# Checklist

<!--
Please check the appropriate items below if they apply to your diff. This is required for changes to Expo modules.
-->

- [ ] Documentation is up to date to reflect these changes (eg: https://docs.expo.dev and README.md).
- [ ] Conforms with the [Documentation Writing Style Guide](https://github.com/expo/expo/blob/main/guides/Expo%20Documentation%20Writing%20Style%20Guide.md)
- [ ] This diff will work correctly for `expo prebuild` & EAS Build (eg: updated a module plugin).

pull_requests.title: [schemer] replace few Lodash methods with native code
pull_requests.body:
# Why

This is first PR from the upcoming series in which I would like to focus on removing Lodash methods from the CLI codebase.

The idea is to keep the changeset small so the potential issues can be easily caught or even revert if needed.

# How

Replace `fill` and `flatten` methods by the native counterparts.

# Test Plan

`tsc` compilation and `fieldPathToSchemaPath` tests were successful.

pull_requests.title: [website] store editor theme and mode in local storage
pull_requests.body:
# Why

Currently, often first thing done when I open a new Snack is to change the theme to dark mode. üòÖ 

Since the editor preferences are non-crucial or sensitive data in any way we can use the browser local storage to store them to improve the users UX.

# How

This PR adds store and load code for the editor theme and mode.

I have placed this on top of all overrides for it has the less priority and will be overwritten by, for example, theme provided in query string.

Also to improve the readability a bit I have extracted the editor mode possible values to the separate type.

# Test Plan

The changes have been tested by running the website code on localhost.

# Preview

> No preferences in LS => Set/toggle preferences => Reload website

![Kapture 2021-12-09 at 16 24 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/719641/145425119-3bc7742b-06b3-4e50-81ab-f8179c19075f.gif)

pull_requests.title: [docs] simplify main documentation page component

# Why

Main documentation component, besides the right sidebar (ToC), was one of the files still waiting for the rewrite.

# How

Simplify the `DocumentationPage` a bit, by extracting some helper methods and condensing part of the logic with other components. 

I did not move or rename the file yet, since we need to refactor the ToC and various contexts first, to be able to fully rewrite the component adapting out latest code standards.

# Test Plan

The changes have been tested by running docs website locally. I was not able to detect any differences between the current production, or any regression.

# Checklist

pull_requests.title: split The New Architecture guide into few pages
pull_requests.body: This PR splits the New Architecture guide into few smaller pages which all are located in the "The New Architecture" section in the sidebar. I hope this will improve the overall readability of the guide for the users, since the split has been request few times. The new pages titles can be improved for sure, I was focusing on trying to fit them in one line, but maybe it is an overoptimization, hope someone will look at that later. üòÖ In this PR I have been focusing on the layout and formatting, no on the content itself, however there were small whitespace changes and syntax highlight correction, applied while I was moving the content. To achieve the effect visible below I had to alter few lines of CSS, because non-linkable sidebar entries were missing a proper style (they were not used before) and we were unnecessary overwriting the sidebar sub-sections font size due to class name changes on the Docusuaurs side. Those changes will be pushed in separate PR against `main` branch. ### Preview

# How

pull_requests.title: [html-elements] web: fix headings HTML tag
pull_requests.body:
# Why

Fixes #20410
Fixes #20458

# How

It look like RN and RNW are now more aligned, and there is no need to pass `aria-level` as before, `accessibilityLevel` is sufficient, see: 
* https://necolas.github.io/react-native-web/docs/accessibility/

I have also changed the accessibility role to the correct value `heading`, since the previous one was not valid, see:
* https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#heading
* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/heading_role

# Test Plan

Snapshot before this changeset shows that there was a problem with the headings after latest RNW update, so after performing the changes I have regenerated the snapshots.

# Checklist

pull_requests.title: [next-adapter] fix incorrect detection of webpack 5
pull_requests.body: # Why I was working on the `with-nextjs` Expo example update to use Next 10+, when I spotted that besides Next was using Webpack 4 for the compilation, Next was failing with an Internal Error pointing out to the code guarded by `isWebpack5` flag. After an investigation in code, it looks like the `webpack5` flag was set incorrectly, when there was no `webpack5` entry in `args`. # How This small change fixes the incorrect Webpack 5 detection and allows in the future update of `with-nextjs` example. # Test Plan I have init app using `npx create-react-native-app -t with-nextjs` then I have copied in the updated build files of `next-adapter` to test app `node_modules` which fixed the Internal Server Error.

pull_requests.title: [docs] switch to the new font system introduced in Next 13
pull_requests.body:
# Why

Currently the fonts fetch and load time looks like the biggest culprit to the docs load time. 

Let's try switch to the new Next font system, which is recommended for the font performance optimization:
* https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/font-optimization

# How

Remove all manually imported fonts, remove the `fontFamily` references from Styleguide, tweak styles.

The regular font has not been changes since Inter is already a variable font in Google catalogue, Menlo has been replaced with Fira Code for now (very similar fonts).

# Test Plan

All test pass besides one, for the old ToC component. the failure is related to the Jest import system and inability to correctly resolve font loader. App looks as expected, when running locally.

It looks like this has been resolved for the `next/jest` package in https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/42413, so probably it will be possible to mimic this in our Jest setup to fix the failing test.

Another way to fix the test is to make a pure monospace paragraph and then replace the HTML element used, instead of passing monospace `fontFamily`, this also should be the cleaner approach, but it needs a small code refactor.

# Checklist

<!--
Please check the appropriate items below if they apply to your diff. This is required for changes to Expo modules.
-->

- [ ] Documentation is up to date to reflect these changes (eg: https://docs.expo.dev and README.md).

pull_requests.title: [intent-launcher] loosen the parameter type for `startActivityAsync`
pull_requests.body:
# Why

Someone reported to me, that during the `IntentLauncher` refactor for the docs autogeneration I have tighten the `startActivityAsync` activity parameter type, which now (when using TS) throws an error, when user want to use the custom string to start the intent.

You can see the example of that the usage in FileSystem docs:
* https://docs.expo.dev/versions/latest/sdk/filesystem/#filesystemgetcontenturiasyncfileuri

# How

Loosen the `activityAction` parameter type, which should now also accept custom `string` given by the user.

I have also regenerated the docs data JSON file, so it included the correct type in `unversioned` docs.

# Test Plan

`yarn` and `yarn test` commands run in the package directory were successful.

# Checklist

<!--
Please check the appropriate items below if they apply to your diff. This is required for changes to Expo modules.
-->

- [x] Documentation is up to date to reflect these changes (eg: https://docs.expo.dev and README.md).

Ideally we should start to group the docs files into subfolders (v1 doesn't support this afaik, but it should not be a problem in v2. * update the Architecture sidebar, so it structure matches the other top-level pages on the website (flipped `collapsible`) * reorder platforms in one of the sentence to alphabetical order. ### Sidebar preview

pull_requests.title: [docs] replace absolute URLs to docs with relative ones
pull_requests.body:
# Why

Refs #15368

During the review of PR above, I have spotted that there are places where links to Expo docs are used in absolute form instead of the relative one.

This format moves them out of scope for the docs link checker, which can results in broken links on production. Also using relative links often reduce the redirects count or full re-render attempts.

# How

Replace all viable absolute links to other Expo docs pages with the relative ones.

I have also fixed few other link and typos here and there (unnecessary `.md`, unnecessary path manipulation `/../../..`, etc.).

# Test Plan

The changes have been tested by running docs website on `localhost`. 

I did not test every changed link, but definitely the majority of them.

# Checklist

<!--
Please check the appropriate items below if they apply to your diff. This is required for changes to Expo modules.
-->

- [X] Documentation is up to date to reflect these changes (eg: https://docs.expo.dev and README.md).

pull_requests.title: Add support for original filename when downloading
Fix missing leading zeros in decimals
pull_requests.body:
This fixes leading zeros being omitted from `decimal` output.

Previously, `Fraction(3, 100).decimal()` would return `0.3`. The function now returns `0.03`.

pull_requests.title: Use `Math.isclose()` and true `float` comparison
pull_requests.body:
We used to "upscale" floats to Fractions for comparison.

Now we downscale Fractions to floats and use `Math.isclose()`.

pull_requests.title: Add support for terminals that redirect input such as MINGW64
pull_requests.body: Given that it's not possible to use `Console.ReadKey` when the input is redirected, I'm suggesting an approach using `Console.ReadLine` to display a prompt (with a visible cursor). In other words, the user now has to hit `` after typing one of the letters (`a`, `r`, or `s`). As a bonus, the full words `accept`, `reject`, and `skip` are also valid. --- Closes #1

pull_requests.title: feat: container-size attr w/ premeditated naming
pull_requests.body:
adds a `media-container-size` attribute.

the breakpoint definition would look a bit like this `s:0 sm:396 m:576 ml:960 l:1280 xl:1600 2xl:1920`

I did some research on the size naming and I was looking for a naming pattern that overlapped in characters with sizes next to each other. was a little inspired by wetsuit sizing üòÑ 
https://360guide.info/wetsuits/wetsuit-sizes-explained-how-to-choose-between-s-ms-m-mt-l-xxl-and-others.html

CSS attribute selectors have different kinds; starts with, ends with, contains etc.
so it would be cool if we could take advantage of that and select a range of sizes with 1 selector.

`media-controller[media-container-size=s]` selects only the first
`media-controller[media-container-size*=s]` selects first 2 sizes
`media-controller[media-container-size*=m]` selects small/medium, medium, and medium/large
`media-controller[media-container-size*=l]` selects medium/large, large, extra large
etc...

this is definitely not set in stone. happy to hear your thoughts.

pull_requests.title: Add Nuxt.js 3 example
pull_requests.body:
There's one issue with Vite not handling our Mux elements minified bundles correctly.
It throws an error 

```
Unexpected error when starting the router: SyntaxError: Identifier 'h' has already been declared
```

It's because our bundles already have a symbol called `h` and Vite tries to inject this import at the top of our bundles

```js
import { h } from '/_nuxt/node_modules/.vite/deps/vue.js?v=8f0c34a1';

var Be=(t,a,e)=>{if(!a.has(t))throw TypeError("Cannot "+e)};var l=(t,a,e)=>(Be(t,a,"read from private field"),e?e.call(t):a.get(t)),c=(t,a,e)=>{if(a.has(t))throw TypeError("Cannot add the same private member more than once");a instanceof WeakSet?a.add(t):a.set(t,e)},k=(t,a,e,i)=>(Be(t,a,"write to private field"),i?i.call(t,e):a.set(t,e),e);var p=(t,a,e)=>(Be(t,a,"access private method"),e);var z=class{addEventListener(){}removeEventListener(){}dispatchEvent(a){return!0}};if(typeof DocumentFragment=="undefined"){class t extends z{}globalThis.DocumentFragment=t}var ae=class extends z{},_e=class extends z{},ra={get(t){},define(t,a,e){},upgrade(t){},whenDefined(t){return Promise.resolve(ae)}},ie,Ne=class{constructor(a,e={}){c(this,ie,void 0);k(this,ie,e==null?void 0:e.detail)}get detail(){return l(this,ie)}initCustomEvent(){}};ie=new WeakMap;function oa(t,a){return new ae}var ft={document:{createElement:oa},DocumentFragment,customElements:ra,CustomEvent:Ne,EventTarget:z,HTMLElement:ae,HTMLVideoElement:_e},yt=typeof window=="undefined"||typeof globalThis.customElements=="undefined",h=yt?ft:globalThis,E=yt?ft.document:globalThis.document;
```

See the snippet `,h=yt?ft:globalThis,`.

It's a bug on their side.
I temporarily fixed it by not minifying our bundles for the Nuxt.js example

pull_requests.title: fix: support more expression syntax for size logic
pull_requests.body:
Discussion in https://github.com/muxinc/media-chrome/discussions/370

The goal is to extend the expression syntax enough to evaluate more complex conditions like 

```html
<template if="width > 480 && height < width"></template>
```

`width` and `height` should be passed automatically. 
the `if` expression would be collected and evaluated in a ResizeObserver callback, only on a change of result will the template part replace (show / hide) the template contents.

it would also be possible to set these on a specific object to not collide with the attribute properties. something like

```html
<template if="media.width > 480 && media.height < media.width"></template>
```

pull_requests.title: Override the github git source
pull_requests.body:
Override the github git source instead of changing manually all entries

## Before

```
$ bundle install --path vendor/bundle
The git source `git://github.com/mtsmfm/cocoon.git` uses the `git` protocol, which transmits data without encryption. Disable this warning with `bundle config git.allow_insecure true`, or switch to the `https` protocol to keep your data secure.
The git source `git://github.com/bm-sms/daimon_news-layout.git` uses the `git` protocol, which transmits data without encryption. Disable this warning with `bundle config git.allow_insecure true`, or switch to the `https` protocol to keep your data secure.
```

## After
```
$ bundle install --path vendor/bundle
Fetching https://github.com/mtsmfm/cocoon.git
Fetching https://github.com/bm-sms/daimon_news-layout.git
```

### Refs

[Rails way](https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/12d5c21031446686898d5bac924ff3e9e34b6a7d)

# PR Summary

Fix typo: Github -> GitHub

<!--
    Delete this comment block and summarize your changes and list
    related issues here. For example:

    This changes fixes problem X in the documentation for Y.

    - Fixes #1234
    - Resolves #1235
-->

## PR Checklist

<!--
    These items are mandatory. For your PR to be reviewed and merged,
    ensure you have followed these steps. As you complete the steps,
    check each box by replacing the space between the brackets with an
    x or by clicking on the box in the UI after your PR is submitted.
-->

- [x] **Descriptive Title:** This PR's title is a synopsis of the changes it proposes.
- [x] **Summary:** This PR's summary describes the scope and intent of the change.
- [x] **Contributor's Guide:** I have read the [contributors guide][contrib].
- [x] **Style:** This PR adheres to the [style guide][style].

<!--
    If your PR is a work in progress, please mark it as a draft or
    prefix it with "(WIP)" or "WIP:"

    This helps us understand whether or not your PR is ready to review.
-->

[contrib]: https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/community/contributing/overview
[style]: https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/community/contributing/powershell-style-guide

This will mostly automate styleguide conformance (!!!) and is now used by jquery/jquery.

There are a few outstanding peices like checking the spacing around braces. I'll see if I can PR stuff to https://github.com/mdevils/node-jscs/issues/47 to iron out the remaining gaps.

pull_requests.title: JSCS: Disallow Yoda comparisons
pull_requests.body:
Prevents comparisons with literals as the left param and a variable as
the right

pull_requests.title: WB: Remove unnecessary string coercion
pull_requests.body: $homepath is already a string

pull_requests.title: disallowQuotedKeysInObjects: Exclusion array
pull_requests.body:
Fixes gh-47

Doesn't follow the nested property format as described in the linked issue, but I'm happy to change that if it is the preferred approach.

pull_requests.title: Change comment type to prevent empty CSS selector
pull_requests.body:
Sass will emit an empty CSS selector when an orphan rule contains a `/* */` comment block

___

Let me know if you want a built version with the PR, but it will remove this dead CSS rule https://github.com/dimsemenov/Magnific-Popup/blob/844ffea1c9e817b69eb3e5a46d4c2402cb835685/dist/magnific-popup.css#L312-L313

pull_requests.title: Don't emmit "px" for zero units
pull_requests.body: This should be fixed in the other formatters too, but I'm scratching my own itch because I'm trying to add CSSLint again.

pull_requests.title: Use Clang and GCC on Travis
pull_requests.body: Switch language flag to C++. All Travis VMs have Ruby, so the spec test still run fine.

pull_requests.title: NPM Test fix for Windows
pull_requests.body: Follow up to #80, as it looks like the `jscs` call still needs the `node` to run properly on Windows.

pull_requests.title: Build: fix demo asset copying and minification
pull_requests.body:
- Don't copy SCSS files to unmin
- Use better scope for copying umnin assets to minfied
- Fix CSS minification so that the unminified copies aren't left in the production folder

Fixes gh-3867

pull_requests.title: Country Content: Add French demo content
pull_requests.body: Beware :ghost:  Some Google translate text ahead ...

pull_requests.title: Share: output sprite and SCSS inside plug-in dir
pull_requests.body:
Outputs the sprite image under the `share/assets` and the Sass under `share/sprites`

@LaurentGoderre this is pretty subjective, but I wanted to remove the root `src/assets` folder. Feel free to close if you don't agree :wink:

- Move demo ajax files under the "demo" folder
- Remove unnecessary `data-post-remove` values

pull_requests.title: i18n: Add missing commas for missing Spanish translations

- EditorConfig setting added to prevent whitespace trimming on Save for CSVs

___

I actually came accross this because GitHub said there was a parsing error on line 196 :smile:

htmlcompressor seems to be randomly failing, this should retry this line

- Fixed whitespaces
- Removed capital "C" from simplecustomized example

pull_requests.body: Maybe a better idea to change go `~1.0.14` to allow minor patch versions, but I didn't want to alter your current fixed version approach.

- "_" partial files are excluded now by default
- Remove "Other" regular SCSS compiling since it is for demos only

pull_requests.title: Ignore "_" partial files
pull_requests.body:
This matches the expected behaviour in Ruby globbing

Fixes gh-72

Related to https://github.com/sindresorhus/grunt-sass/pull/49

pull_requests.title: Ignore "_" partial files
pull_requests.body:
This matches the expected behaviour in Ruby globbing.

A better issue description can be found in https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt-contrib-sass/issues/72, but I don't use the Ruby version anymore.

I didn't put this behind an option flag, but it might make sense.

pull_requests.title: Build: Minify demo CSS

- Don't copy the unminified version of the JS from "unmin"
- Remove unused "other" uglify task

Fixes gh-3896

pull_requests.body:
Generates menu items in both languages for plugins and polyfills. Note the plug-ins menu is currently rather long.

- Minor spacing fix for sitemenu.hbs

# Work In Progress, do not merge

Looking to reformat the readme so the options use heading that can be linked to directly.
I only fully converted the first few options, but I wanted to see if you're OK with the format before I try doing it for all the options.

You can see how it would look rendered here https://github.com/nschonni/node-jscs/blob/98fee00cfe1d499e60c4f5eac448dfbbde1e70c9/README.md

Initial pass at adding back in the CSSLint validation.
- Turned off all failing rules, but they should be reviewed again
- 2 PRs sent upstream to fix linting issues that can be disabled once they are merged
- Found Twitter wasn't being imported properly, so it was added back in when enforcing the RTL text-indent rule

pull_requests.body: Not sure if this is the right place, but 4.0 brought in a bunch of fixes from libsass

pull_requests.title: GitHub security
pull_requests.body:
Got an email about an insecure dependency in the Gemfile so I started digging in.
- Remove the Gemlock
- Fix HTMLProofer changes
- Fix HTMLProofer errors flagged
- Remove a little dead code

pull_requests.title: chore: update link to the renamed Open Resource
pull_requests.body:
These might end up getting pulled out, but the old "Prefered OSS" link is broken right now.
Also make absolute links to relative so they should get checked by the linter.

pull_requests.title: Add Markdownlint and Travis-CI
pull_requests.body:
Looks pretty big, but it's broken down into separate commits.
- Adds Markdownlint https://github.com/markdownlint/markdownlint and applies simpler rules
- Took a quick spellcheck. Could add https://github.com/ai/yaspeller-ci later
- Add Travis-CI so PRs will match style

Parts I skipped, but should probalby be looked at
- Documents are starting at H2
- Add line wrap limit. This would have made this even harder to read, so it was skipped for now

Someone with the repository administrator access would need to turn on the Travis-CI hook https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/getting-started/

pull_requests.title: chore: fix list spacing issue in Definitions
pull_requests.body: Fix the build (i think)

pull_requests.title: chore: MD013 fix linelengths longer than 80
pull_requests.body:
Ignoring the assessments from build because the tables seem to make it choke.
The benefit of this is that future changes are easier to see since Git won't just highlight the whole paragraph when one word is changed. Downside is that sometimes content would need to be re-flowed depending on the change

pull_requests.title: Move Prettier CI checks to filtered jobs
pull_requests.body: Split this out of a larger PR to replace the Superlinter job. Thought this one might be easier to land, since this task causes some unrelated failures in other PRs. Now the job only runs if a related file type or config file is touched, so it shouldn't cause those issues next time

<!--
IMPORTANT:

This repository contains configuration for what users see when they click on the `Actions` tab and the setup page for Code Scanning.

It is not:
* A playground to try out scripts
* A place for you to create a workflow for your repository
-->

## Pre-requisites

- [ ] Prior to submitting a new workflow, please apply to join the GitHub Technology Partner Program: [partner.github.com/apply](https://partner.github.com/apply?partnershipType=Technology+Partner).

---

### **Please note that at this time we are only accepting new starter workflows for Code Scanning. Updates to existing starter workflows are fine.**

---

## Tasks

**For _all_ workflows, the workflow:**

- [ ] Should be contained in a `.yml` file with the language or platform as its filename, in lower, [_kebab-cased_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kebab_case) format (for example, [`docker-image.yml`](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/blob/main/ci/docker-image.yml)).  Special characters should be removed or replaced with words as appropriate (for example, "dotnet" instead of ".NET").
- [ ] Should use sentence case for the names of workflows and steps (for example, "Run tests").
- [ ] Should be named _only_ by the name of the language or platform (for example, "Go", not "Go CI" or "Go Build").
- [ ] Should include comments in the workflow for any parts that are not obvious or could use clarification.

**For _CI_ workflows, the workflow:**

- [ ] Should be preserved under [the `ci` directory](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/tree/main/ci).
- [ ] Should include a matching `ci/properties/*.properties.json` file (for example, [`ci/properties/docker-publish.properties.json`](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/blob/main/ci/properties/docker-publish.properties.json)).
- [ ] Should run on `push` to `branches: [ $default-branch ]` and `pull_request` to `branches: [ $default-branch ]`.
- [ ] Packaging workflows should run on `release` with `types: [ created ]`.
- [ ] Publishing workflows should have a filename that is the name of the language or platform, in lower case, followed by "-publish" (for example, [`docker-publish.yml`](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/blob/main/ci/docker-publish.yml)).

**For _Code Scanning_ workflows, the workflow:**

- [ ] Should be preserved under [the `code-scanning` directory](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/tree/main/ci).
- [ ] Should include a matching `code-scanning/properties/*.properties.json` file (for example, [`code-scanning/properties/codeql.properties.json`](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/blob/main/code-scanning/properties/codeql.properties.json)), with properties set as follows:
  - [ ] `name`: Name of the Code Scanning integration.
  - [ ] `organization`: Name of the organization producing the Code Scanning integration.
  - [ ] `description`: Short description of the Code Scanning integration.
  - [ ] `categories`: Array of languages supported by the Code Scanning integration.
  - [ ] `iconName`: Name of the SVG logo representing the Code Scanning integration. This SVG logo must be present in [the `icons` directory](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/tree/main/icons).
- [ ] Should run on `push` to `branches: [ $default-branch, $protected-branches ]` and `pull_request` to `branches: [ $default-branch ]`. We also recommend a `schedule` trigger of `cron: $cron-weekly` (for example, [`codeql.yml`](https://github.com/actions/starter-workflows/blob/c59b62dee0eae1f9f368b7011cf05c2fc42cf084/code-scanning/codeql.yml#L14-L21)).

**Some general notes:**

- [ ] This workflow must _only_ use actions that are produced by GitHub, [in the `actions` organization](https://github.com/actions), **or**
- [ ] This workflow must _only_ use actions that are produced by the language or ecosystem that the workflow supports.  These actions must be [published to the GitHub Marketplace](https://github.com/marketplace?type=actions).  We require that these actions be referenced using the full 40 character hash of the action's commit instead of a tag.  Additionally, workflows must include the following comment at the top of the workflow file:
    ```
    # This workflow uses actions that are not certified by GitHub.
    # They are provided by a third-party and are governed by
    # separate terms of service, privacy policy, and support
    # documentation.
    ```
- [ ] Automation and CI workflows should not send data to any 3rd party service except for the purposes of installing dependencies.
- [ ] Automation and CI workflows cannot be dependent on a paid service or product.

We require that these actions be referenced using the full 40 character hash of the action's commit instead of a tag.  Additionally, workflows must include the following comment at the top of the workflow file:
    ```
    # This workflow uses actions that are not certified by GitHub.
    # They are provided by a third-party and are governed by
    # separate terms of service, privacy policy, and support
    # documentation.
    ```
- [ ] Automation and CI workflows should not send data to any 3rd party service except for the purposes of installing dependencies.
- [ ] Automation and CI workflows cannot be dependent on a paid service or product.

# Pull Request

<!--
The text in these markdown comments is instructions that will not appear in the displayed pull request,
and can be deleted.

Please submit pull requests against the develop branch.

Follow the existing code style. Check the tests succeed, including lint.
  npm run test
  npm run lint

Don't update the CHANGELOG or command version number. That gets done by maintainers when preparing the release.

Commander currently has zero production dependencies. That isn't a hard requirement, but is a simple story. Requests which 
add a dependency are much less likely to be accepted, and we are likely to ask if there alternative approaches to avoid the dependency.
-->

## Problem

<!--
What problem are you solving?
What Issues does this relate to?
Show the broken output if appropriate.
-->

## Solution

<!--
How did you solve the problem? 
Show the fixed output if appropriate.

There are a lot of forms of documentation which could need updating for a change in functionality. It
is ok if you want to show us the code to discuss before doing the extra work, and
you should say so in your comments so we focus on the concept first before talking about all the other pieces:

- TypeScript typings
- JSDoc documentation in code
- tests
- README
- examples/
-->

## ChangeLog

<!--
Optional. Suggest a line for adding to the CHANGELOG to summarise your change.
-->

pull_requests.title: fix: remove Serializable interface from AuthenticationContext
pull_requests.body:
The AuthenticationContext component is Serializable because the idea was to potentially inject it into Vaadin views, but this may cause several issues:

* a single instance of that class per application is expected, but if deserializating views we may end up with many of them
* logoutSuccessHandler and logoutHandler are transient, but they are not Spring beans, and we do not provide a simple way to inject them upon deserialization
* for the above reasons, AuthenticationContext may not work correctly with Kubernetes Kit

This change removes the implementation of Serializable interface and updates javadocs.

pull_requests.title: fix: avoid duplicate JS const declaration on license checker script
pull_requests.body:
## Description

When adding license checker script a global constant name originalCustomElementDefineFn is declared. This produces browser errors in portlet addon, because the script may be added multiple times on the same page.

This patch stores the originalCustomElementDefineFn reference under window.Vaadin container and adds a guard to set it only if not already present.

## Type of change

pull_requests.title: fix: collect changes until UI is not dirty (#15517) (CP: 23.3)
pull_requests.body:
When UidlWriter collects changes to send to the client, it may happen that UI is still dirty because features may enqueue additional changes. As a side effect, if UI is still dirty after UIDL response is written, a useless PUSH action is performed.
This change performs changes collection until the UI is no more dirty.

Fixes #14887

pull_requests.title: feat: Add the Authentication Context bean to the Vaadin Web Security (#15129) (CP: 23.3)
pull_requests.body:
- AuthenticationContext is a concrete class that gets access to the authenticated user and allows performing logout integrated with Spring Security
- AuthenticationContext is an injectable managed bean
- Developers can plug additional LogoutHandlers in VaadinWebSecurity.addLogoutHandlers()
- VaadinWebSecurity configures a LogoutSuccessHandler with a redirect strategy that can handle also XHR UIDL requests (UidlRedirectStrategy)

pull_requests.title: Better too large error
pull_requests.body:
I was having an issue where the push failed, but I couldn‚Äôt figure out which record was causing the problem. It turned out to be a large `ul` (I fixed the issue by indexing `p,li` instead of `p,ul`), but there was no way to tell that from this message:

```
Algolia Error: HTTP Error 
Cannot POST to https://XXXXX.algolia.net/1/indexes/main-search_tmp/batch: {"message":"Record at the position 281 is too big size=10406 bytes. Contact us if you need an extended quota","position":281,"status":400} (400)
```

Now, it will output something like this:

```
Algolia Error: Record too big 
Record path: /smokey/Commands.html ¬ß Privileged commands
Content: 
 !!/report <post URL 1> [<post URL 2>...

pull_requests.title: Conform the quotes in Markdown link titles to the singleQuote option
pull_requests.body:
**Prettier 1.9.2**
[Playground link](https://prettier.io/playground/#)
```sh
--parser markdown
--single-quote
```

**Input:**
```markdown
[foo][ref]
[bar][other-ref]

[ref]: https://example.com (bar)
[other-ref]: https://example.com (Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet" is a famous play)
```

**Current output:**
```markdown
[foo][ref]
[bar][other-ref]

[ref]: https://example.com "bar"
[other-ref]: https://example.com "Shakespeare's \"Romeo and Juliet\" is a famous play"

```

**Output after this PR:**

```markdown
[foo][ref]
[bar][other-ref]

[ref]: https://example.com 'bar'
[other-ref]: https://example.com (Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet" is a famous play)

```

The printer uses `()`-style quotes if the title has both `'` and `"` in it.

pull_requests.title: Upgrade to latest remark (with support for ESM)
pull_requests.body:
Closes #86.

Node.js 12.17 and above support ESM natively. Since this module needs to still be able to be consumed as CommonJS, I‚Äôve taken advantage of the fact that Eleventy renderers are async to enable the use of dynamic `import` for Remark and Remark plugins.

Although I haven‚Äôt thoroughly tested this change, the integration test still works. Using custom plugins should continue to work ‚Äî if they are ESM, they can be imported either by manually using `import()` or by passing the module name (in which case, the default export will be used).

Rollup has been removed since it tried to transform `import()` to `require()`. I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs really a reason to bundle this, since it isn‚Äôt intended for browser use, and because the ESM version was not previously hooked up.

The test suite does not currently work, because Jest doesn‚Äôt properly support ESM.

pull_requests.title: Promote universal filters above per-language filters
Improve status menu UX, fix accessibility bug
pull_requests.body: Since there have been more and more items added to the status menu recently, I‚Äôm proposing two changes to improve UX here. First, I've added a separator between the post-specific actions (translate/bookmark/share/delete) and the user-specific ones (mute/block/report). When looking at your own post, the divider is hidden (since the user-specific actions are not available). Secondly, for folks who use accessibility tools, the mute/block/report actions are moved to a ‚Äúsubmenu‚Äù accessed by selecting the ‚ÄúManage Author‚Ä¶‚Äù custom action (please please help me come up with a better title for this) which opens an action sheet with those actions.

pull_requests.title: Improve status accessibility
pull_requests.body:
Closes #378, fixes all but the last item of #309, Fixes #733!

Status views in threads/on the timeline now have actions for reply/reblog/favorite, and also adopt the actions from the post action menu.

pull_requests.title: Hide post contentMetaText when it is empty
pull_requests.body:
From an accessibility perspective, this fixes some weirdness where people would be able to navigate to the text view but it would not be read to them as anything, and they would have to swipe again to see any attachments.

From a visual perspective, this removes the weird double gap between the author view and the media views.

pull_requests.title: Add an Atom feed
pull_requests.body: This lets people follow the latest updates from their feed reader

pull_requests.title: Add geiger counter functionality
pull_requests.body:
Inspired by (and reusing the sound from) [KMCGeigerCounter](https://github.com/kconner/KMCGeigerCounter), this PR adds an optional tick sound played if the current frame is > 1 frame duration past the previous frame‚Äôs expected next frame time. This makes it easier to catch dropped frames even if they don‚Äôt produce visible scroll jank.

Some things I might want to add (but I want to make sure you‚Äôre interested first):
- some sort of coloring when the Geiger counter would be triggered
- a toggle button right on the indicator to enable/disable the sounds (so the option doesn‚Äôt get lost)
-

pull_requests.title: Differentiate between ‚ÄúMy followers‚Äù and other accounts followers for i18n
pull_requests.body: - See: https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon-ios/issues/752

pull_requests.title: Use relative date formatting for long post timestamps
pull_requests.body:
This fixes #759.

That said, I don‚Äôt really like this area of the code. The `UIView.isZoomedMode || metricButtonTitleLength > [magic number]` check is weird to me and it would be great to rewrite it in SwiftUI to use the `ViewThatFits` view in iOS 16, or an equivalent UIKit construct that allows us to change the text of the label as the available space changes.

pull_requests.title: Fix VoiceOver trap in thread titles
pull_requests.body: Fixes #542! I‚Äôm not sure why this fixes the issue but it does. Now the `DoubleTitleLabelNavigationBarTitleView` sets itself as an accessibility element with no children, and sets its label to `title, subtitle`. Navigation through the title area now works properly!

pull_requests.title: Add an accessibility label to emoji
pull_requests.body: Tested locally and it seems to work ok! I‚Äôm not sure if we want to have it read as `:foo:`, `foo`, `:foo: emoji`, or `foo emoji` but I‚Äôm going with just `foo` (no punctuation) for now. Ideally it would follow the ‚ÄúEmoji Suffix‚Äù setting in the Settings app but I can‚Äôt find an API for that.

pull_requests.title: Bump to iOS 15 deployment target + MetaTextKit 4
pull_requests.body:
This brings the app up to the latest version of MetaTextKit and drops support for iOS 14, allowing the use of more modern APIs.

- @MainasuK can you take a look a the changes in this PR to make sure I‚Äôm using the updated API correctly? Especially the changes in `MastodonUI/Extension/MetaLabel.swift`.
- I couldn‚Äôt spot any issues with the new version after doing a quick round of testing but this should definitely be run for a while on beta/dev devices to make sure nothing has broken

pull_requests.title: Set the Mastodon text attachment‚Äôs image to the full-size loaded image
pull_requests.body: This is a step towards unlocking text drag support in the Mastodon app (once updated to the latest MetaTextKit).

pull_requests.title: Support cards in status views
pull_requests.body:
This continues on the amazing work from @kylebshr in #688.

fixes #234, fixes #518, closes #688

Changes from that PR:
- A divider line is now added between the image and the text
- slightly-off-square images are now treated as square
- A max height (400pt) is set for the image, taller images will be center-cropped.
- For cards that support HTML embeds (such as YouTube videos), tapping on the new ‚Äúload embed‚Äù button will open an inline web view with that HTML. This even supports video playback (including full screen, PiP, and background)!
- Tapping on the status itself will no longer highlight the card separately (which was a confusing behavior IMO)
- a bit of other code reorganization
- Long pressing on a card brings up a context menu with options to copy the link, share the link, or compose a new post with the initial content ‚Äú[link] via @‚Äãuser@‚Äãdomain‚Äù
- cards are no longer visible in notifications

Some possible improvements:
- figure out why the border is hard to see in dark mode
- add additional context menu actions?
- add the same context menu to links in the text? (the code could use a context menu interaction with `UIPreviewParameters(textLineRects:)` configured to crop the preview down to just the link)

pull_requests.title: Add a CI job that blocks PRs from modifying old Core Data models
pull_requests.body:
This check helps prevent at least two kinds of issues:

1. Accidentally changing old models (which causes could cause issues with migrating people running old app versions)
2. Changing the current version of the model, then having your PR not be merged while new model versions are created, then doing a merge without realizing that your commits no longer update the current version of the model.

See the checks below for an example of the error message ü§û

pull_requests.title: Improve accessibility of the media UI
pull_requests.body:
- now, focus is trapped within the `MediaPreviewViewController` when it is open, so folks don‚Äôt end up accidentally navigating screens underneath the preview
- focus is automatically switched back to the image/gif/video in the grid that was visible when the preview was dismissed
- the escape gesture now works to leave the preview
